website_summaries.verdict: This dispenser is a favorite among cupcake makers. It's dishwasher safe, but holds up better when the spout is washed carefully by hand.
pros: Quick-release handle gives control and rapid shutoff
Top-rack dishwasher safe, but hand-washing may extend life of the dispenser
Keeps the mess off the counter
cons: Washing around dispenser spout can be tedious

customer_reviews.title: Been using mine for 9 years now!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tool for the kitchen. I mostly make pancakes with it but sometimes cupcakes. Never any problems. I was looking to see when I bought mine so I could gift the same type to my friends house warming and saw that I bought mine 9 years ago. And still making pancakes with it. Pros: easy to use and no leaking Con: the cleaning up the spout at the bottom is annoying and a little hard to clean. I soak mine to make it easier and use hot hot water. Still I'd buy this again in a heartbeat and will should it ever crap out on me.
customer_reviews.author: ANGELA

customer_reviews.title: Overall happy
customer_reviews.text: They are a little thinner than name brand ones I’ve purchased locally. But were easy to hand wash. I’m using them to portion out toddler snacks. Maybe I’ll bake with them, but that wasn’t my real intent. I’ve baked with the thicker ones in the past and was very hard to get off without destroying the cupcake or muffin, so maybe these thinner ones will actually be better.
customer_reviews.author: Mizz87

customer_reviews.title: Received package broken. And the plate that is connected ...
customer_reviews.text: Received package broken. And the plate that is connected to the lever has white spots all over it which worries me. It's obviously a very cheap product if I received it in this condition. I attached photos of a broken edge where there was supposed to be plastic all the way around as well as some of the white spots on the plate that keeps your batter in the dispenser if you're not pulling the lever.
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and simple enough to clean
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and simple enough to clean. Some reviews claim that you could mix your batter directly in the canister...i was not successful in this endeavour but if you're more patient that me you could probably do it. It does occationally drip a very small amount and of course if your batter is real thin it will drip more. But im very happy with this product and my 2yr old can now help make pancakes and cupcakes with out completely destroying my kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Addi

customer_reviews.title: Pancake Envy
customer_reviews.text: Perfectly uniform, round pancakes every time. We bought this to help make quick action, circular pancakes for guests. There is an occasional need to minimally stir the bottom to avoid clumps and clogs bit overall works very well. Alton Brown mighr not endorse this unitasker device, but we find it albeit silly - quick helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. & Mrs. X

customer_reviews.title: Work like a charm!
customer_reviews.text: My initial impression was that these appeared a bit small and somewhat flimsy but are anything but. I was a very infrequent muffin maker because my large muffin pan had to be stored outside my tiny kitchen and was also a royal pain to clean. Have already used these more in the short time I've had them than I did my pan in the last several years. They perform perfectly, clean easily...just a swish in soapy water. Of course, wish I'd purchased long ago. I definitely see more muffins in my future. (Would be nice if offered in something other than the 'Autumnal' shades but not a big deal.)
customer_reviews.author: camSoCal

customer_reviews.title: Good for use in wax warmers
customer_reviews.text: I’m using these in my wax warmers and so far so good. The used wax pops right out after it’s cooled and hardened. Keeps my wax warmers clean, the molds haven’t melted at all, and the heat can still warm the wax to release the fragrance. I have not baked with these.
customer_reviews.author: Sauvignon Mom

customer_reviews.title: Must have
customer_reviews.text: My son in law is a whiz at making waffles and pancakes, so I thought this dispenser would come in so handy for him. He loves it. Says it's easy to make the perfect round pancakes and distributes the right amount for waffles. My daughter has hijacked it for her cupcakes and baking.
customer_reviews.author: Angry Rooster

customer_reviews.title: I don’t the sticky stickers
customer_reviews.text: The container comes with 2 big stickers that are not easily removable, the stickers cover the measuring marks. There is no sign saying dishwasher safe, so I assume it is not dishwasher safe. With these minor issues, it works well as a dispenser
customer_reviews.author: YYHJ

customer_reviews.title: Not a full cup, but lightweight
customer_reviews.text: These cups are very thin and flexible (unlike the flower-shaped black and red ones from Freshware that I've also reviewed), making them more like typical liners than standalone baking cups. However, this makes for easier peeling, though plenty of cake ends up getting stuck in those small crevices. Someday someone will make baking cups that result in no stuck cake, and I will purchase hundreds of them. I promise.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Pull handle gently
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Works well. Be sure to pull on the handle from the bottom end. I pulled on the top end with the 1st one I bought and it broke. But I loved the product so much I bought a second one. This time I'm just more careful on where I pull on the handle.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I know these are for baking but that's not what I use them for. I use them to put my wax melts in my wax warmers. It keeps me from having to scrape wax out of them
customer_reviews.author: Renee

customer_reviews.title: Not what I was expecting/wanting
customer_reviews.text: This product didn’t work for what I needed them for. I use them in my scented wax burners for easier clean up.. but these couldn’t withstand the heat and upon taking it off of the burner it started peeling and falling apart everywhere. Not sure how they might do in the oven although I certainly wouldn’t want silicone peeling in my food..
customer_reviews.author: kindra mason

customer_reviews.title: Stick to cupcake/pancake batters... muffin batter is too thick!
customer_reviews.text: Tried using it to dispense muffin batter (thicker than cupcake)... super slow, at the beginning nothing was coming out so I removed half of the batter in order to ‘push’ out the rest of it. Ended up pouring all of the batter the old fashioned way (in my case, ice cream scoop and spoon). As the name suggests, from now on I will use it for cupcake batter and hopefully have better luck. Will update once I’ve tried it.
customer_reviews.author: linker47

customer_reviews.title: Great for pancake batter
customer_reviews.text: It feels a bit cheap, but we love this tool. We use it several times a week for pancakes. I have tried it for muffin batter, but it seems like it does not handle anything thicker than pancake batter. Pancakes have never been easier!
customer_reviews.author: Mama T

customer_reviews.title: Too hard to clean to be worth it
customer_reviews.text: Well, these do eliminate the need to buy paper baking cups. I didn't have problems with getting the muffins or cupcakes out of the cups, even when I made low fat varieties which tend to stick in paper. I did, however, have problems getting the cups clean. Neither my dishwasher nor handwashing was effective and it always took multiple attempts to get them clean. I will be retiring these for use as backups if I forget to buy paper cups which are far less hassle.
customer_reviews.author: JL

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this batter dispense because I was making a wedding cake out of 175 cupcakes. I used the cake mixes with the pudding in mix. This batter mixes up very light and fluffy. The dispenser did not work well with this lighter batter type, but does work well with regular mixes and with pancake mix. I use it often with all other types of batters that require this approach. I would recommend the product. I was pleased with the product overall and pleased with the service. It was delivered ahead of schedule and as promised. I would buy from this seller again.
customer_reviews.author: Jan

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful silicone baking cups
customer_reviews.text: I love these silicone cups. It is so much more convenient to always have baking cups on hand, than to run out of paper ones and need to run to the store. These are very good quality and fairly thick. The colors are gorgeous. They clean up very easily. You do get a tiny bit of cake stuck in the grooves of the cup when you peel the cup off of the cupcake, but it is just the slightest bit and it does not ruin the cupcake/muffin at all. I would buy these again if I ever need more. It was a great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: MyPenNameTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: WOW What a GREAT product!
customer_reviews.text: I bake a lot of muffins and cupcakes. I placed the silicone liners in my muffin pan, sprayed them with cooking spray and even the cornbread with "cheese" muffins popped right out. I always HATED trying to clean muffin pans, and when I used cupcake liners for this type of muffin, the muffins stuck to the liners. I couldn't get over how cleanly they popped out of the liners. I used the same temperature, baked the same amount of time and they baked evenly. Very pleased with this product.
customer_reviews.author: G. Kent

customer_reviews.title: Great for holding board game bits.
customer_reviews.text: I have to admit that I use these to hold wooden playing bits from a board game called Caverna. I have not baked with these. For my needs, they worked great as they stood upright and held lots of pieces without caving (hah, get it? insider gamer joke), or flopping about and dumping the pieces. They stack super easy so I can stuff them in my game bag. Sorry, this review probably won't help most people but some gamer may come across it.
customer_reviews.author: Chris M.

customer_reviews.title: These are a bigger hassle than using paper cup liners
customer_reviews.text: I make a LOT of muffins, and was curious about whether these would make the task easier. I should have thought things through a little better. Washing these are a pain. The little creases in these silicone liners make washing them more labor intensive than washing a muffin tin. I've gone back to using paper liners and will probably put these into the next rummage sale that I have.
customer_reviews.author: Jean Baker

customer_reviews.title: Amazing silicone muffin liners!
customer_reviews.text: Chicago Metallic Baking Essentials Silicone muffin liners are in a words...amazing!!!! I tested them out last week and couldn't be happier. I made a very healthy muffin with NO oil and the muffins didn't stick at all...they popped right out! I also love the fact that you don't have to use a muffin tin...I just laid the liners out on a cookie sheet and they turned out perfectly. Clean up was a cinch...which is a huge improvement over my ancient metal muffin tins! Love this product!!!
customer_reviews.author: homeschoolbythebeach

customer_reviews.title: Stand up on their own very well
customer_reviews.text: I use these to make "egg muffins" which are basically baked omelets. These stand up really well on their own and it is so nice to be able to stack them all up when you are done and they take up hardly any space. I like these so much better than my silicone muffin pan that I recently gave away. The only negative is that you have to remove the contents upon cooling to prevent them from sweating and making things soggy.
customer_reviews.author: T. Justice

customer_reviews.title: Awesomeness ....
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product because I like to make cupcakes and always had the hassle of pouring the batter into the cupcake pans. First try and I immediately fell in love. It takes a lot of work out of clean up and is easy to use and handle. I'd recommend this for anyone. The one downside was that a particular cupcake I make uses a lot of bulky indgredients and since the hole for the dispenser is pretty small it took longer to pour out. Other than that, A for this item. I'm even considering buying two more to save for the future :).
customer_reviews.author: Dom G

customer_reviews.title: Purchased for a church campout and it was amazing! Still have to mix in a separate bowl ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for a church campout and it was amazing! Still have to mix in a separate bowl and pour into the container so one more thing to clean, but worth it!
customer_reviews.author: JP01

customer_reviews.title: Not Just for Cupcakes
customer_reviews.text: While I do not use them as intended, these little gems are great for my packed lunches. I was getting a little depressed with the amount of little plastic baggies I was using, and began to look for alternatives. They serve as good dividers for items in a lunch container that doesn't see a lot of flopping around; I put things such as thick sauces, sauerkraut, the filling for my sloppy Joes in these to keep them separate from ingredients they may make soggy or mix with that shouldn't. When home, pop them in the dishwasher on the top shelf or hand wash and voila! Ready to reuse.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: it's useable, but not so great to clean
customer_reviews.text: These are great for saving paper, however they take more time...it takes a ridiculously long time to clean them. That is my biggest complaint. Perhaps once I get a dishwasher I will feel differently. For now, I just have gone back to using the regular foil/paper baking cups. Also, people do seem to at first be a little concerned when there are cupcakes "naked" haha! Once I explain it they are okay with it!
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: Even better than the ones I bought a few weeks ago
customer_reviews.text: I baked muffins with these this morning. Worked great. I bought another brand a few weeks ago, and these seem a little better. Bottoms are a little sturdier and have a coating, which will probably make them less prone to discoloring. This was a problem with the other ones after a few uses. No after taste but I wonder what the coating is. Muffins came out easily with almost no sticking at all. Even easier to clean than the other brand.
customer_reviews.author: mom300

customer_reviews.title: This worked surprisingly well, The only real issue that ...
customer_reviews.text: This worked surprisingly well, The only real issue that I can see is that if I have to use a mixing bowl (with a pour spout) to mix the batter, I can cut out this middleman... But it helps keep your portions down to measurable levels...
customer_reviews.author: J. Gilbert

customer_reviews.title: Easy to reuse for muffins.
customer_reviews.text: Work great. No spray needed. Cupcakes come out and only a bit of the bread sticks but washes off. No one eats the wrapper anyway so these are easier than removing the paper wrapper no matter how easy it is to throw away the paper cups after they have been peeled off muffins. Tried them using pumpkin cake using en-r-g egg replacer.
customer_reviews.author: A. Pender

customer_reviews.title: Bought for School Lunches
customer_reviews.text: I did not purchase these baking cups for baking and so I have not used them for baking. I use them in divided lunch containers to hold things, and they work very well for that. For example, I send pita pizzas with my son for lunch on occasion. I use these baking cups for the olives and the cheese. They are great in the divided containers because they are flexible and they are not taller than the container. I have not had any spills out of them either.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Versatile Little Cups
customer_reviews.text: These baking cups are useful and easy to clean. Because my recipes usually make 18 muffins, I use the dozen silicon cups for myself and use paper liners for giveaways. I like the idea of not having to purchase liners as often, but these silicon cups mean more washing up which I'd rather not have to do. I can also foresee being able to use them for other purposes than baking as other reviewers have suggested.
customer_reviews.author: Brandy's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as Advertised
customer_reviews.text: Not my favorite color scheme, but they work rather well in my regular sized muffin tin. Muffins have less of a "crust" along the sides using these cups and have more of a slick finish, but the clean up is by far easier. It also really helps when making egg "muffins" and everything slides right out of the baking cup with zero effort! I've used them a couple times and so far there's been no degradation of the silicone so far, but I've only been washing them by hand.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn Carpenter

customer_reviews.title: You'll never go back.
customer_reviews.text: Once I realized these existed, paper cups seem kind of primitive and savage.
customer_reviews.author: TotesMcgoats

customer_reviews.title: Solid product, ingredients get in groves
customer_reviews.text: I like these a lot. They are easy to use, sturdy when pouring or pressing batter into them. They work great as far as baking with them and the baked goods don't stick to it for the most part. However, some of the ingredients get in the grooves and the dishwasher doesn't really wash it out. I have to wash it by hand to get it out and even use my fingernail to force it out. I think something with wider grooves would be a little easier to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Southernmost22

customer_reviews.title: Awesome idea.  No need for a muffin pan.
customer_reviews.text: These are great for using for Dutch oven cooking while camping. Its great to be able to make things like muffins for breakfast this way. You can put 10 of them in the bottom of a 6 quart Dutch oven and the smell of fresh blueberries when you lift the lid lets everyone know its time to eat. The baking cups hold up like you would expect and peel away cleanly from the food. Great idea to be able to bake without a muffin pan.
customer_reviews.author: Scouter5446

customer_reviews.title: Worked great a few times
customer_reviews.text: Worked great a few times. I only hand washed it—never in the dishwasher. After a few washes, the two rings/seals fell off meaning fluid leaks out the bottom. This was a replacement one that I had used for years with no issue. Bummer!!
customer_reviews.author: EvanB

customer_reviews.title: Buy them.
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE these baking cups! * Food removes very easily. I've made egg/cheese omelets and cornbread muffins, and they pop right out. * Simple to clean. Nothing is ever stuck on! * Easy to store. They stack and fit in a very small space. SO much easier than a muffin tin! * No messy cupcake papers. * Double-duty: my 3-year-old loves to sort things into them and play with them. I have nothing negative to say at all.
customer_reviews.author: Jim's Wife

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for using with melted wax
customer_reviews.text: Love the Autumn colors! Great for using with electric scented wax burner. Not having to clean tray for each new scent. Just pour melted wax in mold and it's ready for reuse later.
customer_reviews.author: Adele

customer_reviews.title: Love these!
customer_reviews.text: Great colors and baked items slide right out. The only time I have trouble with them sticking is when I make egg-free muffins for my allergic son which have a different consistency anyway. They don't work well in my dishwasher since I don't have anything to hold them down, but hand washing is easy. I try to rinse them off soon after removing the baked good so what little remnants are left come off easily without having to soak in warm water at all.
customer_reviews.author: H.A.

customer_reviews.title: I love these cups
customer_reviews.text: I have a full size oven that takes 30 minutes to warm up and more than that to cool down but regular muffin pans will not fit in my counter top oven. With these cups I use a 12" x 12" cookie sheet and place these cups on it. The oven heats up in 3-4 minutes and I can back a couple of batches before the regular oven is hot enough to use. The dough will stick a little bit so use paper liners or non-stick spray.
customer_reviews.author: S. Miller

customer_reviews.title: not for all batter types
customer_reviews.text: I like this dispenser and it's easy enough to use. Plus I found it very easy to clean up after. The only problem is thicker batters either don't flow at all, or they just drip out very, very slowly. As long as you are aware of this, it's really no big deal. Batters that are too thick to flow, are easy to scoop into cupcakes any way. So for your average cupcake batter, or pancake batter, this dispenser is quite nice and is priced appropriately.
customer_reviews.author: Gamer Girl

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy
customer_reviews.text: Too flimsy to hold shape when stand alone. Good for small cupcake pans
customer_reviews.author: R. J. Farr

customer_reviews.title: Pancakes, Cupcakes, and Ebilskivers
customer_reviews.text: I use it for pancakes, but my wife loves it for making cupcakes. Also super nice for making Ebilskivers!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Get these!
customer_reviews.text: If you plan on doing any baking, or making of muffins these things are the bees-knees (sorry for the lame cliche) I use these all the time to make egg/bacon/veggie paleo muffins and they create the perfect muffin every time, and never stick. The best part is the clean up, wash them out really quick and let them dry and you are good to go! I love these things.
customer_reviews.author: K. VanWagner

customer_reviews.title: These are fantastic! They're a little thinner than some other silicone ...
customer_reviews.text: These are fantastic! They're a little thinner than some other silicone baking cups I've seen, but that doesn't seem to effect function. I use these almost weekly to pre-make some "egg muffins" for breakfasts.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Shum

customer_reviews.title: Definitely recommend buying!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these baking cups to make candies in (by freezing), flavored ice cubes, frozen homemade broth, frozen wine cubes for cooking, and just regular muffins! I'll never have to buy paper baking cups again! Since they are dishwasher safe, I put them on the top rack. They were easy to clean by hand too. Definitely buy these if you are even thinking about them, they will save you time and money.
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for tiny living
customer_reviews.text: Love these silicone molds. Use them for muffins in the air fryer since my muffin pan wont fit
customer_reviews.author: Brittany C.

customer_reviews.title: Very cute, but a minor flaw.
customer_reviews.text: These baking cups are definitely solid. You can push down on one with your hand and the sides won't bend. However, a couple of the individual cups had flaws such as chips or a crack at the top of the cup. None of these flaws go past the very top of the cup. However, I do love the fall colors and I'll definitely be using them again and again.
customer_reviews.author: Sherri Griffin

customer_reviews.title: Very nice and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Love this; only negative is the way it measures. Hard to see and I wish the measurements went the other way. Still a great product with much less mess filling the cupcake tins.
customer_reviews.author: SANDY HUFF

customer_reviews.title: These work great!
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe it's taken me this long to buy these. These are so useful--not just for baking, freezing small portions of applesauce or pesto, prepping spices, etc. You can fit way more on a baking sheet than you can using a regular muffin tin. Makes things so much more efficient. They come out of the baking cups quite easily and cleanup is simple! Love these and I'll probably get more!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon User

customer_reviews.title: very bad quality gadget
customer_reviews.text: I was so exited to receive this cake batter dispenser. It was wonderful to use it to fill the mini cupcakes and mini brownies mold. I used it with one batch and just at the end, the handle came appart and although I was able to put it back together, it continues to come appart. Now I am trying to glue it back!! I am outside of USA and the shipping cost to send it back would be very high. But I am going to return it any way. I am rating it one satr because it is a great idea, if it would work!!!
customer_reviews.author: Sonita

customer_reviews.title: Food pops right out
customer_reviews.text: After scrubbing and scrubbing baked-on egg out of a cupcake pan, I knew there had to be a better way to make mini-fritattas. These were the perfect solution. I use them in the cupcake pan for support and have the non-stick ease-of-use. They can also be used on a cookie sheet without the bulky awkward storage of cupcake pans (which don't seem to stack neatly within any other baking pan).
customer_reviews.author: roadkill9

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed
customer_reviews.text: I made muffins recently and it was hard to get them out of the cups without some if not half of the muffin sticking to it inside. Also, it's very hard to clean the cups by hand, haven't tried the dishwasher, but a lot of residue is left behind from the baked product. Will not recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: SALI2011

customer_reviews.title: Very small, but work perfectly
customer_reviews.text: It clearly lists the size, but I had no clue what size a standard cupcake was. They're about a 1/4" smaller, so they don't fit very well in a standard cupcake tin. I'm sure they're more of a proper serving, they clean up well (easily), nice and thick so you don't need a tin; overall a very good product. Could be cuter colors :-)
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for bento
customer_reviews.text: I've used these cups for my toddler's lunches for over a year. They're super durable and keep wet ingredients like cut fruit or cottage cheese isolated from dry side items without getting soggy or slouching like paper cupcake liners. My only complaint is that, similar to all silicone cookware, these pick up the smell of soap over time. As suggested in the product description, these should be washed by hand or on the dishwasher top shelf, though even the top shelf doesn't usually work out because these flip over easily from the spray pressure.
customer_reviews.author: J. Tucker

customer_reviews.title: Nice, great quality
customer_reviews.text: These are very nice and easy to use. Pro's: Just as described. Easy to use Dishwasher safe Safe up to 400F (that's pretty stinking high in my opinion, I don't plan to test that) Con's: Smell kinda plasticy when baking Washing them, how does one load them in the dishwasher so they stay put?
customer_reviews.author: Erica B

customer_reviews.title: No stickage
customer_reviews.text: I've only used them once. I made popovers. The popovers came right out with no stickage, however, they all ended up on the small size - didn't inflate the way they're supposed to. I don't know if it's just bad luck, or had something to do with the baking cups.
customer_reviews.author: Value Conscious

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: These cupcake muffin inserts are great. I used them to make muffins and they hold their shape nicely and cleanup is a breeze. Glad I finally decided to buy these.
customer_reviews.author: alvinleejohnson

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PRODUCT!!
customer_reviews.text: I used it for my Red velvet cupcake batter,as you know it's a loose batter. Messy to dip for cupcakes.Bakers heaven.much needed device.works perfectly no mess underneath. stable for pouring in batter. Love it!! I only wish i could find one a little larger that would hold the entire recipe in one pour. It took 2 pours of my recipe.But it's great!!
customer_reviews.author: Linda Graham

customer_reviews.title: Hard to clean
customer_reviews.text: Cupcakes stick really bad in these. I cleaned at least 3x and still not clean.
customer_reviews.author: Lora Rob

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Where has this been all my life, I bake Alot, it cut out so much time, works great easy to use and clean, love it, 1 thing though wish it came with a lid
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl Redmond

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful, and cute liners.
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used these liners yet. I found them whilst viewing a recipe on chocolate cups. I'm planning on using these liners to make the chocolate cups, and I'll put dark chocolate mousse in them. I picked these because my recipe indicated that these were the cups used and that they are perfect. So far, I am pleasantly impressed by the size, thickness, and softness of the silicon. I would recommend these to any pastry chef and home-cook.
customer_reviews.author: Noah S.

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected. Keep in mind that it may ...
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected. Keep in mind that it may be slow going for thicker batters.
customer_reviews.author: Randy R.

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Work well. They stand up by themselves so that they don't need to be put into a muffin tin. Some of them have a tendency to fold in slightly, which ruins the shape of whatever I am baking. This isn't a big deal for me though. Super easy to get my eclairs out. Barely any sticking and no need to spray them.
customer_reviews.author: E. C.Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Great for No-Mess Baking!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product! Great for meal prep. My roommate and I made egg white 'muffins.' I forgot to oil them all and it was not problem because they popped right out! Minimal cleaning and lightyears better than using a standard muffin tin. Also a plus, my set came with an extra couple cups. Great manufacturer error! :)
customer_reviews.author: M. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Liquid Only
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping it would work for all my batter needs, but it only works for really liquid batters. So, no, it doesn't meet my expectations. It does work fine for the liquid batters, but I make so many that are thicker that it really doesn't help. But good concept.
customer_reviews.author: Carol A. Cooper

customer_reviews.title: I like it... but....
customer_reviews.text: This is definitely a great idea and I really like it but the reason for only 4 stars is it doesn't reallynwork well with cake batter. It's less messy but much more time consuming then doing it the messy way cleaning up and then taking a nap. I have yet to try it with pancakes but hopefully that's more pleasant!
customer_reviews.author: Miss Ashley Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Work Perfectly
customer_reviews.text: I was very impressed with these silicone baking cups. So nice to have the muffins/cupcakes come out without a problem. They washed up fairly easily and I love being able to use them over and over again. I have also used them in lunch containers to separate foods for my daughter.
customer_reviews.author: C Smith

customer_reviews.title: I recommend it.
customer_reviews.text: Worked great! We used it several times, and it held up well.
customer_reviews.author: Ellie

customer_reviews.title: Cheap
customer_reviews.text: I bought this thinking it'll end my relatively uneven cupcake size issue. However, when you grasp the handle to release batter, the handle gets stuck, and you sort of manually have to push it back to where it was originally so it would stop dispensing batter. Pulling and manually stopping the dispensing process inevitably will lead to uneven cupcakes and a mess, probably even bigger cupcakes as it'll keep on dispensing until you stop it. I'm better off with my ice cream scooper to divide the batter. I really dislike the quality of this product, I thought with it being from Chicago Metallic it would really stand up to its name but unfortunately not.
customer_reviews.author: ReemA.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: These are nothing short of fantastic. Easy to use, easy to clean; I have been completely happy with them. They fit nicely into my muffin tins, but also work perfectly fine just on a cookie sheet. I recommend them to friends and I'd recommend them to you.
customer_reviews.author: WolfSong

customer_reviews.title: a great baking essential
customer_reviews.text: I've been making a lot of cupcake type foods lately, and I'm not a big fan of the paper liners. The food comes right out of them and I feel like I'm reducing my carbon footprint by not using so many paper cupcake liners. The best part is they go in the dishwasher. I love these.
customer_reviews.author: R. Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: These baking cups are perfect. I've used for regular muffins and egg based cups. Always allows easy release. Easily clean with soap and water and don't take up much storage space. I never use my regular muffin pans now. Plan to buy another set!
customer_reviews.author: Blanche

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: Works great. No mess. Easy to clean. Even distribution of batter.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for eggs
customer_reviews.text: I make a bunch of mini frittatas on the weekend to make breakfast easy and quick during the week. Cleaning eggs out of a muffin pan is awful. These made cleanup so easy! You don't even need non-stick spray (I tried with and without).
customer_reviews.author: Michele Begley

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to clean by hand
customer_reviews.text: Love them, but wouldn't recommend them unless you have a dishwasher. They are tedious to clean by hand, and even in the dishwasher they do not get fully clean. But function well as baking cups, I haven't had any baking-related issues with them.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Durable and reusable
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I bake muffins and take one each for lunch every day. We were going through so many muffin papers it made sense to switch to a reusable liner. We've been using these for well over a year; the silicone is slightly discolored but has held up amazingly well. Highly recommended to replace disposable paper/ foil liners!
customer_reviews.author: LilacsInMay

customer_reviews.title: ... filling your cupcake pans much easier without all those annoying drips along the side of the pan and ruining ...
customer_reviews.text: This makes filling your cupcake pans much easier without all those annoying drips along the side of the pan and ruining the cupcake liner papers.
customer_reviews.author: oscrap

customer_reviews.title: I can't believe I ever baked muffins without these!
customer_reviews.text: I am SO impressed with these!! I don't usually add oil or shortening to my muffins, to keep them on the healthier side... and it's no problem, they pop right out of these liners without hesitation! I can't believe I just NOW discovered these, afters years of baking! Love 'em... and am ordering several more sets as gifts! (The fun colors are an extra perk too!)
customer_reviews.author: Eener229

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I'd hoped
customer_reviews.text: I've used these several times and they still look good as new. They're sturdier than paper cups and super easy to clean
customer_reviews.author: Tigeress127

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Worked very well when used to make 48 mini muffins. Easy to use. Will see if it holds up over time.
customer_reviews.author: Comprona

customer_reviews.title: My favorite kitchen gadget
customer_reviews.text: I use this dispenser every time I make pancakes, waffles or cupcakes. It is so easy to use and creates much less mess than the other ways I've tried. It is fairly easy to clean.. soak in hot water for a couple minutes... done.
customer_reviews.author: Jenntree

customer_reviews.title: Should have bought more than one set
customer_reviews.text: They do exactly what they say they do. I have baked cupcakes, eggs and more in these things and all without oiling the baking cups and everything slides right out. I do let the food cool for a few minutes, just as I would a regular muffin tin.
customer_reviews.author: frangipanetarts

customer_reviews.title: Buy it
customer_reviews.text: Use it for pouring cupcakes, funnel cakes, pancakes make them anysize and no over pours and you can form Mickey Mouse with ease, and anything else that uses batter. It just makes it so much esaier to do all my baking neater and I mix my batters in the canister and use my boat motor to mix less clean up.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: These are great. I use them to hold different snacks in ...
customer_reviews.text: These are great. I use them to hold different snacks in my son's bento box. They're great. Only problem I had was with the color (but then again I chose them), it was VERY muted.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie & Betsy

customer_reviews.title: CLEANING CUPS
customer_reviews.text: We used these the other day and they worked well (had purchased two sets) however I have had a heck of a time cleaning them - used a toothbrush to scrape the crumbs out but took a long time -- I would like to know what I am doing incorrectly.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just as described.
customer_reviews.text: How did I bake before silicone liners? I love that I can just pop the muffins out. (They are dishwasher-safe, though in my experience they don't come clean in the dishwasher... they get flipped. I hand wash them.)
customer_reviews.author: ndamick

customer_reviews.title: Silcione Cupcake molds
customer_reviews.text: I really like these cupcake molds because I wanted to make chocolate mousse in chocolate cups, and these worked perfectly. I have used them to make cupcakes, with a chocolate shell as well, and they turn out beautifully every time. They are easy to clean, and easy to work with.
customer_reviews.author: wiggie

customer_reviews.title: Works Well!
customer_reviews.text: It works well to distribute batter evenly. One Caveat is that thick batter won't work in this dispenser, because it simply won't come out! Other than that it's fun to load and use. I've got a few fans of the devise that say they want one now b/c it makes for less mess.
customer_reviews.author: B. Kennel

customer_reviews.title: So many uses!
customer_reviews.text: Not only can you cook the typical CUPCAKES.... but think of everything else. I love to make eggs in them -- eggs, spinach, cheese, etc. YUM. So easy. Also easy to use in Convection/Toaster oven! BUY IT!
customer_reviews.author: Abby

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these to use with my needle felting. I make little cupcakes and as cute as they look in paper cups, the paper isn't made to last very long. In these you get the same fun look and last forever. They were also a fantastic deal IMO.
customer_reviews.author: Stacy

customer_reviews.title: Love!!
customer_reviews.text: Have used these 100 times already and I love them. Don't ever want to use paper ones again. Very much worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Melody Craft

customer_reviews.title: Pretty handy baking tool
customer_reviews.text: This dispenser is really nice and a great timesaver. Once you let go of the handle to quit dispensing, it stops immediately and there are no drips. The only thing to be aware of is that when you have dispensed most of your batter, you will need to open the dispenser and spoon the batter towards the middle so it can actually be dispensed.
customer_reviews.author: ThaiDi

customer_reviews.title: Baked my first batch today
customer_reviews.text: We do lots of muffins in our house, most of which are gluten free and can be finicky with muffin cups. These were great this morning with a batch of Coconut flour muffins and a batch of Almond flour muffins. I was able to peel off 2 of them from hot muffins for the second batch.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew G McLean

customer_reviews.title: nice product but I think creates more mess and clean ...
customer_reviews.text: nice product but I think creates more mess and clean up required once use this. more of bowl and ladle person
customer_reviews.author: Anka

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: they are exactly what they say they are, i like not having to find the muffin tin and just setting on a sheet and the colors are much better than the other neon options out there
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely awesome product. The only thing is needs to be bigger
customer_reviews.author: Monty Crawford

customer_reviews.title: Not what this Baker thought it would be
customer_reviews.text: The batter does not come out as it should. It is a great concept if only it worked.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Stanford

customer_reviews.title: love them
customer_reviews.text: easy to peel off, easy to wash, set on towel to dry, pop them back in cupboard. I use only gluten free flour, so stickiness is always a problem with paper cups. Not a problem here. I also use these in soap making--no flavor transfer.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Steinert

product_meta.title: Chicago Metallic Cupcake/Batter Dispenser
product_meta.description: Style Name:Batter DispenserThis Chicago Metallic-cupcake/batter dispenser is perfect for-cupcakes, pancakes and more. It has a 4-cup capacity and measures 6-3/4-inch by 7-1/4-inch by 4-1/2-inch high. To use pour the batter into the-cupcake dispenser ,position over center of-cup and pull the handle for quick and easy filling into the-cup. The-cupcake/batter dispenser is top rack dishwasher safe, but hand washing is recommended to extend the life of the product.
feature_bullets: PERFECT SERVINGS: The Chicago Metallic Cupcake and Batter Dispenser is perfect for filling cupcakes, loaf pans, single serve specialty pans, as well as making pancakes, griddle cakes and waffles. This batter dispenser makes it easy to measure servings.
ELIMINATE MESS: The Cupcake and Batter Dispenser has a mess free design and keeps batter in the 4-Cup dispenser without drips on the countertop and across the pans.
EASY TO DISPENSE: Never worry about dispensing too much batter or filling; with the easy-release design you are able to dispense the perfect amount of batter every time.
QUICK-RELEASE HANDLE: This cupcake and batter dispenser features a quick-release handle for control and an instant shut-off.
DISHWASHER SAFE: Dishwasher safe for quick and easy clean up, top rack only.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars1,097 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
